questions.text: What is the flavor of the singing group called 'Alarm Clock'?
What famous musician's tombstone reads that he was born in New Orleans on July 4, 1900?
questions.explanation:
Louis Armstrong.

	Weaned on the music of Basin Street.  There is some controversy about Armstrong's actual date of birth - it's possible that he lied about it.

questions.text: What musician played the 'sweetest music this side of heaven'?
questions.explanation:
Guy Lombardo.

	Guy Lombardo and his Royal Canadians.

questions.text: What country was Victor Borge from?
questions.explanation:
Denmark.

	Real name Borge Rosenbaum,born in Copenhagen on January 3,1909.

questions.text: Ray Charles was born in what state?
questions.explanation:
Georgia.

	Born September 1930 in Albany Georgia.

questions.text: Who had a hit with 'De Fuehrers Face'?
questions.explanation:
Spike Jones.

	Spike Jones and his City Slickers.

questions.text: Who was the bandleader who asked 'Do you want to lead a band'?
questions.explanation:
Sammy Kaye.

	Swing and sway with Sammy Kaye.

questions.text: Who was the first musician to bring swing to Carnegie Hall?
questions.explanation:
Benny Goodman.

	He was known as the 'King of Swing'?

questions.text: In which voice range did Luciano Pavarotti sing?
What song writer wrote 'To Know Him Is To Love Him'?
